title: Education Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork)
Interview Descriptions: Fair and balanced interview panel. Questions relevant to position being offered. There were plenty of opportunities to outline my skills and experience. I was given adequate time to ask questions after interview. Duration thirty minutes.
Interview Questions: What do you as a tutor look for when assessing student teachers

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: It is good process, including the online interview about the mentioned project and its details. Also, the educational background and previous experience as well as projects. After this the response is speedy and the guidance is also fine to proceed the further steps.
Interview Questions: Scientific question related to communication and IT

title: IT Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University College Cork
Interview Descriptions: Was given a topic beforehand for which I had to give a 10 minute presentation which was timed.  This was followed by 50 minutes interview with 6 person interview panel.
Interview Questions: What do you know about gdpr?

title: Senior Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interviews tend to be quite difficult.  Most positions available for interview are very competetive but even if not, the interviews are tough either way.   It would take a lot of practice to be interview ready.
Interview Questions: Scenario based questions "If this happened, what would you do?"

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University College Cork
Interview Descriptions: Everything was very professional. The question areas were standard teaching, research, contribution/service/engagement. Some slightly difficult questions on working with other disciplines and a HR style question at the start. However, no feedback was provided post interview. On request, very brief and general feedback was provided. Disappointing process because of this.
Interview Questions: Experience of funding, plan for future funding

title: Marketing Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a remote interview so I received an email with the date, time and names of my two interviewers. They were absolutely lovely and really just wanted a chat to see if I suited the university culture. They asked my background and made sure my experience was relevant to the role duties.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you worked in a group?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Cork
Interview Descriptions: Poor, very clear they had made up their minds before the interview. Wasted my time. Refused to shake hands. Borderline rude. Asked questions that they knew I couldn't possibly answer and I knew were not related to the role. Felt like they were planted so another candidate would score highly.
Interview Questions: Presentation on what you would do if you got the role.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview with the Professor about research topic and the requirements of from the research assistant point of view. The interview was done via Microsoft teams and was enjoyable. Other non-research specific topic also were included in the interview.
Interview Questions: How long have you been in this field of research?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Very straightforward, talked through CV. No HR questions. 3 interviewers. Principle investigaters predominantly spoke, along with her head post doc and another senior researcher. Lecturer complemented my CV and said how my qualifications perfectly meet the job description so I didnt have to say much
Interview Questions:
Do you like working in  a team.
Why do you want to do a PhD.

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University College Cork
Interview Descriptions:
Very informal and easy process which felt more like a conversation rather than a job interview.
Met with all the leads on the project I was interning for and was asked for my motivation behind joining the team and relevant experience.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the role?

title: Graduate Trainee Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University College Cork (Kilkenny) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Very effective professionals way to work out the thins in time, deal so nicely, given chance to know each other,
Moral boosting, makes one ready to upgrade. Definitely I would I learned a lot from this session.
Interview Questions: About the Milk product /producing  Industry

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University College Cork
Interview Descriptions: The interviewing panel consisted of 4 people, all very friendly, a lot of detailed questions about my ideas for the post. I felt there was too much accent on marketing which has not been mentioned in the job spec. All in all, it was a very pleasant experience although I did not get the job.
Interview Questions: The marketing experience not mentioned in the job spec

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an extended academic CV, with research, teaching and contributions statements. A few weeks later I was called for interview. The interview is an hour long with a panel of internals and externals.
Interview Questions: What are your teaching methods

title: IT Support Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was smooth and felt like a normal conversation that puts you at ease. Very friendly managers that just want to get to know you. Make sure to go over the job description and company website to get a better idea of the workplace.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work in IT Support?

title: PhD Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Technical abilities, research skills, innovation and critical thinking, report writing, critical analysis, case studies. All these are the topics of the interview. Be prepared although the interview process is fairly simple and looks more like a two way discussion.
Interview Questions: Recent advancements in the field of smart grids. Describe yourself. What are your recent research topic? Are you an independent/self-sufficient researcher? How would you handle any issue like conflict of interest?

title: PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very efficient and timely. Asked all relevant questions, from the CV. Lasted for about 20 mins. I got the offer letter the very next day. You should know your CV and try not to brag and never lie!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: My interview was via Skype. They got back to me within 3 weeks (fast for academia). It was informal and about 30 minutes long. They asked mainly about my former experience and interests and wanted to know which techniques I am familiar with.
Interview Questions: How fast I could move.

title: Senior Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with teaching and research questions, administrative roles , feedback, career vision, suitability for post. Presentation on medical education and research, interacting with staff. Funding vision , availability for mentoring leadership training.
Interview Questions: teaching and research

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Cork in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Process relatively long , and all initial contact up until interview itself was conducted via email. Interview itself was approximately an hour and rather hypothetical questions were posed. Was a positive experience but challenging.
Interview Questions: How would you do things differently regarding your past studies?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Dismissive, I felt the job was already earmarked for someone else and that they simply went through the process, or appeared to, so as to comply with the law. I did not feel they were interested in me. I really don't have anything else helpful to say
Interview Questions: What experience I had

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from the principal investigator to say that I had passed the initial screening process and to organise a suitable time to interview. They were very flexible to arrange a time that suited me.
Interview Questions: Biggest weakness

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 7 weeks. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The process took 7 weeks. I was interviewed by a three-person panel, one other postdoctoral researcher, the project manager and the PI on the project. They were all very friendly, and assisted me with any questions that may have posed difficulties. Overall I found it to be a very positive experience.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with conflict in the workplace?

title: Research Support Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by three researchers on the project. Was pretty nervous but they set me at ease and just walked through my CV highlights. The worst part about the whole process was the time between application and interview (3-4 months) Overall as pleasant an interview as could have been possible.
Interview Questions: Discuss your Masters project in detail

title: Senior Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very straightforward. I applied online and was called for the interview after 3 weeks. The interview went smooth; I was asked some technical questions related to the position I applied for and a few behavioural questions. We went through my CV and everything was relaxing and cool.
Interview Questions: Tell my about your last work experience

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was not an interview, it was simply an open written application. Provide your cover letter, your experience, reasons why you wanted to do the job. There were a number of roles available and they let you know at a later date if you were chosen for the job.
Interview Questions: There were no difficult questions

title: Post Doctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University College Cork in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a great interview. Questions were all related to research interest and learning interest. As a first job I agreed with all the offers. Overall it was a very nice experience. Within 2 hours of interview over phone I was unexpectedly offered a job. In other universities it took at least 2 weeks to get any interview feedback.
Interview Questions: For me it was an easy interview

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. If there was an interview process - obviously this is purely a guess, as there was no interview process - one would imagine that it may have covered such areas as an overall interest in education, why focus on chosen field, what learned to date in chosen field within formal education and what learned outside of formal education, what aims are for next five years, what would like to achieve in academic field - if academia is the long-term plan, why you, what will you bring to the job that others cannot, etc etc
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Standard academic interview: presentation on teaching plan to students and faculty followed by panel interview and meetings with students. Suggested curriculum supplied in advance to inform teaching presentation. All panel questions were very standard and fairly predictable.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University College Cork (Cork) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward submission of CV and research interests. From then on it was a simple process of waiting to be notified of being selected for an interview.
Interview Questions: What research topic would you address if you had a budget of a million euros?
